content:
• Thursday, February 16, 2017
  • RGSE

    RGS Energy +19% following upbeat outlook

    • RGS Energy (NASDAQ:RGSE) +19.5% AH after the company provided a business update following its completed offerings that raised total net proceeds of $16M.
    • RGSE sees a Q4 net loss of $10.5M on revenues of $5.1M, with a gross margin of 23%.
    • The company says it has regained Nasdaq compliance and is now debt-free.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM | 4 Comments
  • DUK

    Duke Energy, up sharply in regular trading, gives ground after-hours

    • Duke Energy (NYSE:DUK) -2.7% AH, giving back much of the stock's surprising gains from today's trade following in-line Q4 earnings and FY 2017 earnings of $4.69 coming in at the high end of the company's guidance range.
    • DUK's 2017 EPS outlook also is in-line, seeing $4.50-$4.70 vs. the $4.61 analyst consensus estimate, but the midpoint of the guidance would mean lower earnings than in 2016.
    • DUK extended its projected long-term adjusted EPS growth rate of 4%-6% to 2021, helped by the addition of Piedmont, which will add earnings to DUK's natural gas operations.
    • Separately, DUK releases new figures that place coal ash cleanup costs in the Carolinas at nearly $5.2B over several years, 50% higher than previous estimates; it is not yet clear how much of the tab will be picked up by customers and how much by shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM | 7 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: TRUE +12.4%. ANET +9.8%. SNPS +5.6%. CGNX +4.6%. TTD +3.4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25 p.m.: None
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM | 6 Comments

  • Notable earnings before Friday’s open

    • AAN, ATRO, B, BLMN, CPB, CTB, DE, ENB, FLR, GLOG, GVA, IMGN, LPNT, MCO, MTRN, NHI, PES, POR, ROCK, RUTH, RWLK, SE, SEP, SJM, TYPE, VFC, WBC, XRAY
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 7 Comments
  • CGNX

    Cognex +5%; Q4 2016, revenue outlook above predictions

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $129.32M (+32.3% Y/Y, $12.39M above estimates), EPS $0.43 ($0.14 above estimates), gross margin 79% (vs. 76% Y/Y), RD&E +11% Y/Y, SG&A expenses +14% Y/Y, investment and other income $2.476M (vs. $2.059M Y/Y), effective tax rate 11% (vs. 13% Y/Y)
    • Other developments – CFO modification, $0.075 quarterly dividend declared
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $122M-$125M (consensus $110.44M), gross margin mid-to-high 70% range, operating expenses +10% Q/Q, effective tax rate 18%
    • Cognex CEO Robert Willett: "We are pleased with our performance in 2016. Revenue grew 16% over 2015 with excellent fall through to the bottom line as evidenced by our record annual net margin of 29%. We completed four acquisitions that bring important technologies in the two fastest-growing areas of our business. And, we introduced new products that substantially expand our addressable market. While there’s uncertainty in the world today, we’re encouraged by the level of demand that we experienced in the second half of the year. Our fourth quarter results were higher than our guidance to investors in October and that momentum continued into January, which leads us to expect strong year-on-year growth in Q1."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:CGNX) $74
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 10-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 5 Comments
  • WBMD

    WebMD +2.7% after earnings beat, strategic planning

    • WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) is up 2.7% in postmarket trading after beating on top and bottom lines with its Q4 earnings and announcing that it had hired J.P. Morgan to pursue strategic options.
    • Revenue by segment: Advertising and sponsorship, $132.2M (up 10.6%); Biopharma and medical device, $38.85M (up 0.2%); OTC, CPG and other, $171M (up 8%); Health services, $28.8M (up 5.8%); Information services, $7.7M (up 15.6%).
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenue of $151M-$154M (down 3-5% Y/Y and below consensus for $166.7M), net income of $9.8M-$11.5M (down 27-38% Y/Y) and EBITDA of $38M-$40M (down 15-19% Y/Y).
    • For the full year, it sees revenues of $710M-$730M (below consensus for $742.9M), net income of $89M-$98M and EBITDA of $233M-$243M (up 1-5% Y/Y).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • TMST

    TimkenSteel EPS of -$1.52

    • TimkenSteel (NYSE:TMST): Q4 EPS of -$1.52 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.40.
    • Revenue of $214.7M (+3.9% Y/Y) beats by $13.91M.
    • Shares +1.58%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • ANET

    Arista Networks +11.4% after strong Q4, upbeat guidance

    • Arista Networks (ANET -0.5%) is up 11.4% after hours, quoting at an all-time high, following Q4 earnings where it posted a clear beat on top and bottom lines and guided strong on next quarter's revenue.
    • The company posted record EPS and grew non-GAAP net income by 35%. Gross margin was 64.4%, up slightly from a year-ago 64%.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $289M (up 32.9%); Service, $38.96M (up 38.5%).
    • For Q1, the company's guiding to revenue of $320M-$330M (above consensus for $304.8M); it sees non-GAAP gross margin of 61-64% and operating margin of about 27%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • TRUE

    TrueCar +12.45%; Q4 2016, forecasts over consensus

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $74.1M (+16.5% Y/Y, $2.79M above estimates), EPS -$0.01 ($0.04 above estimates), net loss $0.5M (vs. $5.2M net loss Y/Y), adjusted EBITDA $5.8M (vs. $0.2M Y/Y)
    • Operational highlights – average monthly unique visitors 7M (+19% Y/Y), units 218,807 (vs. 183,157 Y/Y), monetization $320 (vs. $324 Y/Y), franchise dealer count 11,151 (+23% Y/Y)
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $71M-$73M (consensus $69.86M), units 205K-210K, adjusted EBITDA $4M-$5M
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $315M-$320M (consensus $308.54M), units 920K-930K, adjusted EBITDA $20M-$24M
    • TrueCar president and CEO Chip Perry: "We have come a long way in the year since I joined TrueCar, and we are excited about re-accelerating our top-line growth while also improving our margins.  At this point, I am very confident that we now clearly understand and have our hands placed securely on the practical levers that we believe will enable us to continue to drive double-digit rates of unit and revenue growth for some time."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:TRUE) $14.90
    • Historical financials and metrics
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • Presentation

  • LII

    Lennox International higher amid conference cancellation chatter

    • Lennox International (LII +5.9%) flies higher amid talk that the company has pulled out of a Barclays conference scheduled for next week.
    • Some traders are trying to connect the dots after hearing Emerson Electric (EMR -1.5%) talk M&A at its analyst day today.
    • There's no official word from Lennox on the conference cancellation.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • SAGE

    SAGE spikes 9% on rumored suitor interest

    • SAGE Therapeutics (SAGE +9.2%) jumps on triple normal volume on comments from CEO Jeff Jonas about receiving overtures about a possible buyout after his company reported positive trial data for MDD candidate SAGE-217 earlier this week.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Sage Therapeutics's depression candidate SAGE-217 shows positive treatment effect in Part A of mid-stage study; shares ahead 9% premarket (Feb. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 8 Comments
  • AEM

    Agnico Eagle plans to spend $1.2B in Arctic gold mines

    • Agnico Eagle Mines (AEM -4.5%) is sharply lower after falling well short of Q4 earnings expectations and announcing plans for at least $1.2B in spending to build a gold mine in Canada's Arctic and expand another.
    • AEM's board approves building the Meliadine project and the Amaruq deposit, which is a satellite deposit of the company's existing Meadowbank mine, for expected capital costs of $900M and $330M, respectively.
    • NEM now expects both projects to begin production in Q3 2019, meaning output at Meliadine is now forecast to start about a year earlier than previously expected.
    • The two projects would help expand AEM's gold production to an estimated 2M oz. in 2020 from expected annual production of ~1.55M oz. during 2017-19.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • LBTYA

    Liberty Global LiLAC up sharply on strong regional performance

    • Liberty Global's (NASDAQ:LBTYA) Latin American/Caribbean trackers are up heavily today (LILA +16.1%; OTC:LILAB +20.6%; LILAK +16.2%) in the wake of an earnings report that featured revenue that tripled due to the company's acquisition of Cable & Wireless.
    • That deal brought in $590.7M in new revenue, for a LiLAC revenue total of $922.9M.
    • The company's expecting $150M in synergies from the integration of LiLAC with Cable & Wireless by 2020.
    • "As we head into 2017, we are laser focused on improving the results at [Cable & Wireless] and expect the LiLAC Group to deliver approximately $1.5 billion of OCF for the full year," says Liberty CEO Mike Fries.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: SCON +43%. CSLT +19%. NTES +13%. QUMU +11%. GRVY +11%.

  • SYNT

    Syntel -16%; FY 2017 forecasts under expectations

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $237.89M (-6.6% Y/Y, $1.88M above estimates), EPS $0.57 ($0.03 above estimates), gross margin 40.2% (vs. 41.8% Y/Y, 39.2% Q/Q), SG&A expenses 13.1% of revenue (vs. 11% Y/Y, 12.2% Q/Q), income from operations 27.1% of revenue (vs. 30.8% Y/Y, 27% Q/Q), net income $48M (vs. $74.2M Y/Y, $217.2M net loss Q/Q)
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $900M-$945M (consensus $976.45M), EPS $1.75-$2 (consensus $2.32)
    • Syntel interim president and CEO Rakesh Khanna: "While we were impacted by challenges seen across several industries in the past year, Syntel has started 2017 with a focus on helping our clients build competitive differentiation and gain operational flexibility in an uncertain business climate. Digital enablement and modernizing existing IT assets are increasingly becoming strategic priorities for our customers as they undergo enterprise-wide technology transformations."
    • (NASDAQ:SYNT) $19.57
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • GOLD

    FT: Barrick in advanced talks to sell Kalgoorlie mine stake, President says

    • Barrick Gold (ABX +5.8%) is in advanced talks with a buyer for its 50% stake in the Kalgoorlie gold mine in western Australia, President Kelvin Dushnisky tells Financial Times.
    • Dushnisky does not say if the bidder is China’s Minjar Gold, which last year reportedly made a $1.3B bid for the “Super Pit" mine, half of which is owned by Newmont Mining.
    • ABX rose as much as 7.4% to their highest level in nearly six months after reporting better than expected Q4 results, but shares have pared gains a bit after the company filed to sell up to $4B in shares or bonds.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • VSTO

    Vista Outdoor up after CEO picks up more shares

    • Vista Outdoor (VSTO +4.3%) is higher after the company reported some insider buying.
    • CEO Mark DeYoung picked up 20K shares at an average price of $20.80.
    • VSTO SEC filing
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 2 Comments

  • ASPS

    Altisource Portfolio -22% on earnings, CFPB probe; Ocwen -10%

    • Headline earnings from Altisource Portfolio Solutions (ASPS -22.2%) showed a beat, but the company is guiding to full-year 2017 EPS of just $2.59-$3.05 vs. Street expectations for $4.33.
    • The company also disclosed that the CFPB is considering potential enforcement action over violations concerning certain technology services provided to Ocwen Financial (OCN -9.9%).
    • "Our biggest concern would be a compromising of the relationship between Ocwen and ASPS due to regulatory action," says Piper's bearish Kevin Barker.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Altisource Portfolio beats by $0.23, beats on revenue (Feb. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 30 Comments
  • ECA

    Encana CEO sees holding drilling and completion costs flat Y/Y

    • Encana (ECA -1.8%) is lower despite posting better than expected Q4 earnings, helped by a cash tax recovery and reduced operating expenses.
    • CEO Doug Suttles said in today's earnings conference call that he expected ECA would be able to hold Y/Y drilling and completion costs flat despite cost inflation in some oilfield services; those costs fell by ~30% in FY 2016.
    • ECA forecasts 2017 capex of $1.6B-$1.8B, with total production of 320K-330K boe/day; as a result of asset sales, Q4 production fell 21% Y/Y to 321.5K boe/day from 406.8K boe/day in the year-ago quarter.
    • TD Securities analyst Menno Hulshof says ECA largely de-risked its 2017 drilling program by building up activity before the end of 2016, which meant less competition for services in January and February.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: OTCPK:PSIX +78%. SCON +34%. XTLB +26%. CRSP +16%. CUR +16%. ZSAN +15%. AKER +15%. LILAK +14%. SXE +14%. CRAI +14%.
    • Losers: CFMS -32%. BBW -26%. HOS -26%. OTC:ACUR -23%. ASPS -23%. AVP -20%. MOH -18%. CRY -17%. SYNT -16%. PHH -16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPWR

    SunPower upped at Oppenheimer, as solar vendors acting more rationally

    • SunPower (SPWR -4.4%) is sharply lower following disappointing Q4 earnings and downbeat Q1 guidance, but Oppenheimer is out defending the stock, upgrading shares to Outperform from Perform with a $10 price target as it thinks challenging solar conditions are priced into the shares.
    • The firm says SPWR's Q4 revenue was strong, and 2017 margins should be boosted and continue to rise throughout the year with the help of the new P-series solar panel.
    • Although price competition among solar equipment vendors will continue, SPWR will benefit from its technological innovation, as well as its "global footprint and trusted brand," the firm says.
    • While acknowledging that solar cycle bottoms are difficult to call, Opco says it is seeing more rational industry-wide business behavior than at any other time in its decade of solar coverage, and rationalization efforts undertaken by the industry should start to impact the sector's results by Q2.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 21 Comments
  • CUR

    Neuralstem completes enrollment in mid-stage study of NSI-189 in MDD; shares ahead 19%

    • Neuralstem (CUR +18.6%) hits the enrollment target of 220 subjects ahead of schedule in its Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating NSI-189 for the treatment of major depressive disorder (MDD). Top-line data should be available in Q3.
    • The company says small molecule NSI-189 stimulates neurogenesis, synaptogenesis and increases hippocampal volume, all of which play a role in reversing depression, enhancing cognition and promoting the growth of new nerve tissue.
    • Previously: First patient enrolled in Neuralstem's mid-stage study of NSI-189 in MDD, top-line data expected in H2 2017 (May 12, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 5 Comments
  • TIVO

    TiVo +11.9% after launching dividend, boosting buyback

    • TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) is up 11.9% and back within shouting distance of a 52-week high after earnings yesterday evening where adjusted profits and revenues beat expectations and the company launched a dividend and boosted its buyback authorization.
    • Revenues rose to $252.3M from a previous $149.5M, with the help of the TiVo acquisition (contribution of $125.8M).
    • Net income fell to $9.8M vs. a year-ago $26.3M.
    • It says it's on track to reach cost synergy targets of $100M after the integration of TiVo with its buyout partner, Rovi.
    • It's guiding to 2017 revenues of $800M-$835M, vs. a consensus for $823.4M, and GAAP losses before taxes of $55M to $70M.
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 3 Comments

  • CHH

    Post-earnings rally for Choice Hotels International

    • Choice Hotels International (CHH +9.4%) trades higher after Q4 results top estimates.
    • Domestic system-wide revenue per available room rose 5% during the year to easily top the industry average. Average daily rates were up 2.3%.
    • Looking ahead, Choice expects Q1 EPS of at least $0.49 and 2017 EPS to fall in a range of $2.78 to $2.84.
    • Previously: Choice Hotels beats by $0.03, misses on revenue (Feb. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • PHH

    PHH to Exit Existing PHH Home Loans

    • PHH (NYSE:PHH) -15.5% entered into an agreement with Guaranteed Rate Affinity LLC, a new joint venture established by Guaranteed Rate and Realogy Holdings (NYSE:RLGY) for the sale of certain assets of PHH Home Loans for gross proceeds of $92M.
    • Guaranteed Rate Affinity will acquire certain assets of PHH Home Loans’ mortgage operations, including its four regional mortgage origination and processing centers, corporate relocation division and a substantial majority of employees across the United States.
    • The transaction is expected to include a series of interim asset sale closings with the initial closing targeted to occur in June 2017 and the final closing expected to occur during the 4Q17.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: XTLB +24%. CUR +16%. BNTC +13%. AKER +13%. ZSAN +9%.
    • Losers: CFMS -35%. OTC:ACUR -22%. MOH -18%. CRY -16%. GNCA -12%.

  • Natural gas inventory draw was less than expected in the last week

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -114 Bcf vs. -124 Bcf consensus, -152 Bcf last week.
    • Futures -1.4% to $2.883
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, GAZ, KOLD, UNL, DCNG
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 46 Comments
  • PBA

    Pembina Pipeline unveils Duvernay development and service agreement

    • Pembina Pipeline (PBA +3.9%) opens higher on news it entered into a 20-year infrastructure development and service agreement with Chevron (CVX).
    • PBA says the deal includes an area of dedication by CVX concentrated in the liquids-rich Kaybob region of the Duvernay resource play in Alberta.
    • CVX has the right to require PBA to construct, own and operate gas gathering pipelines and processing facilities among others.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • RUBI

    Rubicon Project +7.4% after deal with SoundCloud

    • The Rubicon Project (NYSE:RUBI) has jumped 7.4% out of the open after news that SoundCloud has chosen the company for automation of its premium audio/video advertising inventory.
    • That gives advertisers a one-stop shop for programmatic access to SoundCloud inventory.
    • The solution will use Rubicon Project's Orders platform to offer first-party and content-level targeting in real time.
    • SoundCloud reaches more than 175M users a month and offers an ad-supported product in eight markets (U.S., U.K., Ireland, France, Australia, New Zealand, Canada and Germany).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM | 3 Comments
  • HIMX

    Himax Technologies +6%; near-term headwinds noted, more positive beyond

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $203.44M (+14.3% Y/Y, -6.7% Q/Q; $0.84M above estimates), EPS $0.03 ($0.04 below estimates), gross margin 19.1% (-650 bps Q/Q, -380 bps Y/Y), net income $4.8M (vs. $21.3M Q/Q)
    • Revenues – large-sized panel driver $67.7M (-6% Q/Q, +9% Y/Y;) small and medium-sized panel driver $99.7M (+0.4% Q/Q, +21.8% Y/Y); non-driver $36M (-22.9% Q/Q, +6% Y/Y)
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue -18% to -25% Q/Q (consensus $173.58), gross margin 23%-24%, GAAP EPS $0.005-$0.02 (consensus $0.04)
    • Himax Technologies president and CEO Jordan Wu: "In the first quarter of 2017, we are seeing weaker seasonality and market demand in associated with our core driver IC business and anticipating near-term headwinds in our non-driver business mainly due to lower LCOS and WLO revenues resulted from our major AR customer’s shift in focus to the development of future generation devices. We also expect our gross margin to be under pressure in the short term due to continuous pricing pressure and less favorable product mix of driver IC products, lower revenues from high-margin AR/VR related businesses and lower NRE income. That being said, looking into 2017, we will leverage our total solution capabilities and focus on major new technology trends to maintain our leading position in our core driver IC business. We also remain positive on the long-term growth prospect of our non-driver business. We are particularly excited about recent developments especially in WLO and CIS product lines where we offer unique and market leading technologies and solutions for IoT and machine vision applications. We have proceeded with the expansion plan for our next generation LCOS and WLO production lines and will start to construct the new office/fab soon. In addition, to meet the strong demand of new customers for our WLO technology, we are accelerating our WLO capacity expansion. After many years of R&D and product development, we may see significant business progress in our non-driver business to contribute to both top and bottom lines out of WLO and CIS areas as early as the second half of 2017. Taken together, we remain committed to our long-term strategy to diversify our product and customer base with innovative technologies, which ultimately, should increase shareholder value."
    • (NASDAQ:HIMX) $6.75
    • Conference call
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 26 Comments
  • GNC

    GNC suspends dividend in debt reduction move

    • GNC Holdings (NYSE:GNC) announces that it will suspend its dividend.
    • The company says the dividend suspension is part of a broader plan to use free cash to reduce debt. GNC intends to reallocate ~$55M of cash annually, primarily to reduce debt through the pay-down of its revolver.
    • Previously: GNC Holdings misses by $0.29, misses on revenue (Feb. 16)
    • Previously: GNC Holdings lower after earnings miss (Feb. 16)
    • GNC -10.70% premarket to $7.43.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 9 Comments

    • Losers: CFMS -36%. OTC:ACUR -29%. MOH -18%. GNC -13%. HOS -11%. CAR -9%. AVP -8%. DF -7%. ESEA -8%. TRIP -6%.

  • CFMS

    ConforMIS Q4 top line up 14%; net loss narrows; soft guidance sinks shares, down 36%

    • ConforMIS (NASDAQ:CFMS) Q4 results ($M): Total Revenues: 21.7 (+13.6%); Product Sales: 21.4 (+13.8%).
    • Net Loss: (15.7) (+5.0%); Loss/Share: (90.37) (unch).
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenues: $80M - 84M (consensus view: $101M); Product Sales: $79M - 83M. Guidance impacted by change in reimbursement in Germany for partial knee replacements. Specifically, customized procedures will be reimbursed at the same rate as off-the-shelf procedures beginning starting last month.
    • Q1 Guidance: Revenues: $17.7M - 18.7M.
    • Shares are down 36% premarket on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 6 Comments
  • ESEA

    Euroseas misses by $0.32, misses on revenue

    • Euroseas (NASDAQ:ESEA): Q4 EPS of -$0.45 misses by $0.32.
    • Revenue of $7.3M (-17.1% Y/Y) misses by $1.8M.
    • Shares +4.5% PM.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings lower after earnings miss

    • GNC Holdings (NYSE:GNC) falls sharply after the company's Q4 results miss estimates.
    • Same-store sales fell 12% Y/Y in U.S. company-owned stores during the quarter.
    • The company reduced its level of web promotions, leading to e-commerce sales accounting for 8.8% of total sales vs. 11.4% a year ago.

  • BHC

    FDA OKs Valeant's Siliq for plaque psoriasis; shares up 3% premarket

    • The FDA approves Valeant Pharmaceuticals' (VRX) Siliq (brodalumab) for the treatment of adults with moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis who are candidates for systemic therapy.
    • Brodalumab is a human monoclonal antibody that binds to interleukin-17 (IL-17), thus blocking its binding to its receptor and inhibiting inflammatory signaling. Valeant acquired global rights (except in Japan and certain other Asian countries) from AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) after Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) terminated development due to concerns over adverse side effects, including increased suicidal thoughts. Amgen submitted the original IND in 2008.
    • Siliq's labeling includes a boxed warning about the potential risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior. It will be available under a Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS) under which prescribers must be certified about the program and counsel patients about this risk. Patients must sign an agreement confirming that they are award of the risk and the need to seek medical attention should they experience suicidal thoughts.
    • Shares are up 3% premarket on average volume.
